intro: Polygala mendoncae, commonly known as Mendonca's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which includes over 700 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
